title: Competitive Ruling: Tainted Minds
body: TL;DR: Over the course of the investigation into the allegations made by players of Tainted Minds, we have interviewed players, team ownership, current and former team staff and Rioters, as well as reviewed written correspondence between all involved.

This ruling is utter crap, especially because the 6 month probabtion period is a JOKE (if you want to follow the reasoning that the issue were mostly TM-players contract issues and Riot didn't help in solve the situation so TM was in relatively good faith while still committing severe violation, and thus you are giving them a second chance by putting them in a probation period rather than kicking them out immediately, you should extend that probation period for FAR longer than 6 months as warning for them and all other OCE organization that they are always under surveillance and can't afford to treat bad their players, **that probation period should have been at least 3-5 years**) , but stop comparing it to Renegades one

Renegades ruling was fair, Monte was having discussion and had reached a verbal deal with Badawi  to make him reacquire 50% of the onwership while Badawi was still banned once Badawi ban period would expire

How the hell was he expecting that a thing such in open contrast with the spirit of the rule that led to first Badawi ban could slip through unpunished and how people can side with Monte on a such clear cut and deliberate violation is beyond me

Then add the shady TDK-REN relationship and the Remilla-Badawi issue (that was the thing referred as player welfare and confirmed by basically everyone including Monte and Badawi) as icing on the cake, and the result was going to be obvious and justified - and if Monte want he can return back, and could always cast even during the ban that was only for operative positions in teams, it is Badawi the one banned permanently (and TDK owners banned indefinitely) -

Renegades ruling was far from fair.

The whole verbal deal with Badawi wasn't against the rules. Like you say, the deal was for Badawi to retain his 50% ownership AFTER his ban would expire. That wasn't against the rules until Riot decided to make it against the rules AFTER it had happened. You can't retroactively punish someone for something they did when it wasn't against the rules.

The whole TDK-REN relationship had no proof. You can't punish people based on hearsay and circumstance. There was no proof that TDK and REN had a behind-the-scenes merge (like Riot was accusing), but Riot punished them because they traded players. Heck, if you want to punish team for trading players, look no further than TSM and Liquid. TSM needed to push Wildturtle back in Season 5 (and potentially replace him), so Liquid gave TSM Keith (who had been having good showings at the time). Then this season, TSM gave Liquid DoubleLift. It's no secret that Liquid and TSM have a good relationship together, but I would be foolish to suggest that they had a behind-the-scenes merger. Teams that are friendly trading among each other isn't proof of against the rules colluding.

TDK-REN were punished for player trading because they continued to pay their former player months after the trade with the former team. You're comparing completely different things. TSM Liquid trades and loans are above board while TDK-REN was not after the initial trade.
Actually, no, it was a backpay because Riot was sending cheques to the wrong gaming house while players were still on the team.

It is idiotic to even mention the G2/FNC thing here
G2/FNC situation was a completely regular and legit situation, heck Riot went overboard and too harsh in that situation, they shouldn't even have forced to rescind that loan

A minor investor of G2 make a loan to FNC owner for a different company owned by FNC owner, the Fnatic Gear one, a company that make computer peripherals with Fnatic logo on it, to help him start up that company and help him paying less interest on a loan compared to what he would have to pay to a bank
Even if they are friends, they do a standard business contract to regulate the loan and the G2 investor to protect his investment put a basic standard business clause in the loan contract, namely a one that says that if the parent company of the Fnatic Gear one isn't able to repay the loan , then the lender can recoup the money given with the loan by getting debtor assets, which are Fnatic Gear assets first, and only subsequently the other assets owned by FNC owner which include at the very end of the company control chain also the FNC LOL team

There was no indipendence/collusion issue there, the lender had no interest whatsoever in gaining any influence/control over FNC LOL team as he was just putting a standard clause to protect his investment, and the that he would have had to get as deep as getting close to control FNC LOL team was very very very remote as the FNC owner has various assets to deal away before getting deep down enough the company control chain to get there, and the FNC owner had obviously no will to see his companies go bankrupt and being forced to give away his belongings up until to the point to give up the biggest drawing for his company, the FNC LOL team

> Hilger's right to Fnatic's shares is only a byproduct of the loan and is conditional on a financial collapse of Sannpa, and therefore Fnatic, as a company at some point in the future. Getting control of Fnatic is not the end goal, and rather the undesired outcome. In the case at hand, it’s a minority owner of a team offering a formal loan to the team’s parent company, for a non-league venture.
